data.title: The Tennessean
data.text:
Si Robertson, Uncle Si from the show "Duck Dynasty," is testing his musical talents in his new six-song album "Me and My Smokin Hot Honey."

"I don't sing," Robertson said at a press conference Thursday. "I make a loud joyful noise."

In honor of his vow renewal ceremony with his wife, Christine, after 43 years of marriage, he and Ashley Nelson, who produced the album, decided to record the songs played at the ceremony.

The album features Kix Brooks, Robertson's daughter-in-law Marsha Robertson, the Mauldin Brothers, Zach Harris, Jessica Andrews and Nelson's husband Jay Nelson. It also includes the ballad "His and Hers" with Ashley Nelson's daughters Ally and Macy Jae Moore and friend Kolby Koloff from the Lifetime series "Preachers' Daughters."

"We had a lot of fun doing it," Robertson said.

Christine Robertson enjoys the album not only for the tribute, but also because her favorite country music singer, Brooks, participated.

"I called Christine and said, 'Who is yours and Dad's favorite country artist?' said Marsha Robertson. "She said, 'Well, hands down Brooks and Dunn, but I know they're broken up, so probably Kix Brooks.'"

Nelson shot Brooks an email asking him to sing with Si Robertson, sent him her song "Can't Take the Swamp Outta the Man," and he was in.

Fans can download the album on iTunes, and also can catch him singing at 6 p.m. today with the Mauldin Brothers at Rippy's, 429 Broadway.
